title: Zone 0: The Home Interior
learning_objectives: Understand Zone 0 principles and energy flows, Identify opportunities for home resource efficiency, Apply permaculture ethics indoors, Create functional indoor growing spaces
key_concepts: Zone 0 as the foundation of permaculture design, Energy and water conservation in the home, Indoor composting systems, Windowsill and indoor food production, Observation starting from home, Connection between indoor and outdoor zones

title: Zone 1: The Kitchen Garden
learning_objectives: Design high-intensity Zone 1 gardens, Select plants requiring daily attention, Optimize kitchen garden placement, Understand daily access patterns and maintenance
key_concepts: Zone 1 definition and access frequency, Culinary herbs and salad greens selection, Vertical growing for space efficiency, Succession planting techniques, Companion planting in intensive spaces, Season extension methods

title: Zone 2: Small Livestock and Intensive Planting
learning_objectives: Design Zone 2 for 2-3 times weekly access, Integrate small animals with plant systems, Select appropriate perennial vegetables and berries, Plan efficient maintenance schedules
key_concepts: Zone 2 access patterns, Small animal integration (chickens, bees, rabbits), Perennial vegetables and soft fruits, Composting systems placement, Tool storage and work areas, Stacking functions in limited space

title: Zone 3: Main Crop Production
learning_objectives: Design low-maintenance Zone 3 systems, Select hardy crops and orchard trees, Plan weekly maintenance schedules, Understand appropriate scale for Zone 3
key_concepts: Zone 3 characteristics and weekly access, Main crop production and storage crops, Orchard establishment and management, Mulching and no-till methods, Cover cropping systems, Swale and water management integration

title: Zone 4: Semi-Wild Forage and Timber
learning_objectives: Understand Zone 4 as managed wilderness, Select native timber and forage species, Practice minimal intervention management, Identify wild food and medicinal plants
key_concepts: Zone 4 monthly to seasonal access, Native tree and shrub selection, Forage plant identification, Coppicing and timber management, Wildlife habitat creation, Edge effects and ecotones

title: Zone 5: Wilderness and Observation
learning_objectives: Recognize the importance of unmanaged land, Practice observation of natural patterns, Understand wilderness as teacher, Apply lessons from Zone 5 to designed zones
key_concepts: Zone 5 as undisturbed nature, Observation before action principle, Learning from natural succession, Understanding ecosystem services, Seed and genetic material collection, Wildlife corridors and connectivity

title: Why Native Plants Matter
learning_objectives: Understand ecological relationships with native species, Recognize co-evolution of plants and pollinators, Learn ecosystem services of native plants, Distinguish native from naturalized and invasive species
key_concepts: Native species definition and importance, Co-evolved relationships, Ecosystem services, Soil biology and mycorrhizal networks, Local ecotype adaptation, Native plant communities

title: Finding Native Plants for Your Bioregion
learning_objectives: Identify your bioregion and native plant communities, Use botanical resources and databases, Understand hardiness zones and microclimates, Source native plants ethically
key_concepts: Bioregional boundaries, Native plant databases and resources, Local plant societies and organizations, Ethical wildcrafting principles, Native plant nurseries, Understanding provenance

title: Native Plant Guilds and Polycultures
learning_objectives: Design guilds using native species, Understand natural plant communities, Stack functions with native plants, Create regionally appropriate polycultures
key_concepts: Natural succession patterns, Native plant layers, Nitrogen-fixers in native ecosystems, Dynamic accumulators, Native groundcovers and living mulches, Mimicking forest edge communities

title: Ecosystem Services of Native Plants
learning_objectives: Identify multiple ecosystem services, Design for pollinator support, Understand soil building functions, Support beneficial insects and wildlife
key_concepts: Pollinator host plants, Beneficial insect habitat, Soil stabilization and erosion control, Carbon sequestration, Water infiltration, Wildlife food and shelter

title: Dealing with Invasive Species Responsibly
learning_objectives: Identify invasive species in your region, Understand ecological impacts of invasives, Learn removal and management techniques, Restore native plant communities
key_concepts: Invasive species definition, Ecological and economic impacts, Removal timing and techniques, Proper disposal methods, Native plant restoration, Prevention strategies

title: Introduction to Plant Guilds
learning_objectives: Understand guild concept and benefits, Identify guild functions, Design simple guilds, Stack multiple functions in space
key_concepts: Guild definition, Functional relationships, Seven layers of food forest, Temporal niches, Spatial arrangement, Dynamic relationships over time

title: The Seven Layers of a Food Forest
learning_objectives: Identify all seven layers, Design complete vertical stacking, Select appropriate species for each layer, Plan succession and maturity timing
key_concepts: Canopy, Sub-canopy, Shrub, Herbaceous, Groundcover, Vine, Root layers, Light requirements by layer, Succession planning, Mature ecosystem structure

title: Nitrogen-Fixing Plants and Guilds
learning_objectives: Understand nitrogen fixation process, Select appropriate nitrogen-fixers, Integrate fixers into guilds, Time chop-and-drop cycles
key_concepts: Biological nitrogen fixation, Rhizobium bacteria, Native nitrogen-fixing species, Chop-and-drop mulching, Guild placement of fixers, Seasonal timing

title: Dynamic Accumulators in Permaculture
learning_objectives: Understand mineral accumulation, Select accumulator species, Use accumulators for soil building, Create nutrient cycling systems
key_concepts: Deep-rooted mineral miners, Nutrient accumulation patterns, Comfrey and other accumulators, Living mulch systems, Biochar and nutrient cycling

title: Companion Planting Science
learning_objectives: Understand allelopathy and plant interactions, Apply scientific companion planting, Avoid problematic combinations, Design for pest management
key_concepts: Allelopathy mechanisms, Beneficial and antagonistic relationships, Three Sisters guild, Aromatic pest confusion, Trap cropping, Scientific evidence vs folklore

title: Observation: The First Principle
learning_objectives: Practice systematic observation, Record site patterns, Understand observation before action, Develop patience in design
key_concepts: Observation through seasons, Site analysis tools, Pattern recognition, Water flow observation, Sun angles and shadows, Wind patterns, Existing vegetation as indicators

title: Understanding Energy Flows
learning_objectives: Map energy flows on site, Design for energy efficiency, Understand solar gain and heat, Minimize energy inputs
key_concepts: Solar energy capture, Wind energy and protection, Water as energy storage, Gravity-fed systems, Passive heating and cooling, Zone placement for energy efficiency

title: Feedback Loops in Permaculture
learning_objectives: Identify positive and negative feedback loops, Design self-regulating systems, Recognize tipping points, Create resilient designs
key_concepts: Positive feedback loops, Negative feedback loops, System stability, Self-regulation, Observation-based adjustment, Resilience through diversity

title: Edge Effects and Ecotones
learning_objectives: Recognize edge habitats, Design productive edges, Maximize edge in landscapes, Understand edge species diversity
key_concepts: Ecotone definition, Edge effect biodiversity, Keyhole beds and mandala gardens, Forest edge design, Pond edge productivity, Creating vs destroying edges

title: Reading the Water Landscape
learning_objectives: Observe water flow patterns, Identify water accumulation areas, Understand watershed context, Read vegetation as water indicator
key_concepts: Watershed boundaries, Catchment areas, Erosion indicators, Hydrophytic vegetation, Seasonal water patterns, Groundwater indicators

title: Swale Design and Construction
learning_objectives: Design effective swales, Calculate appropriate sizing, Understand on-contour placement, Construct swales properly
key_concepts: On-contour water harvesting, Swale dimensions and spacing, Overflow management, Planting swale systems, Maintenance requirements, Common mistakes to avoid

title: Pond Design and Ecology
learning_objectives: Design functional ponds, Understand pond ecology, Site ponds appropriately, Plan for multiple functions
key_concepts: Pond sizing and depth, Natural pond systems, Sealing methods, Edge design, Aquatic plant zones, Wildlife habitat, Integration with broader water system

title: Rainwater Harvesting Systems
learning_objectives: Calculate catchment area, Size storage appropriately, Design distribution systems, Understand filtration needs
key_concepts: Roof catchment calculation, First flush systems, Tank sizing, Gravity-fed distribution, Overflow integration, Water quality considerations

title: Keyline Design Principles
learning_objectives: Understand keyline patterns, Identify keypoint on land, Design keyline cultivation, Improve water distribution
key_concepts: Keypoint identification, Keyline patterns, Contour vs keyline, Subsoiling techniques, Pattern cultivation, Landscape rehydration

title: Understanding Soil Biology
learning_objectives: Recognize soil as living ecosystem, Understand soil food web, Support beneficial organisms, Avoid practices that harm soil life
key_concepts: Soil food web, Bacteria and fungi, Protozoa and nematodes, Mycorrhizal fungi, Earthworms and arthropods, Building biological activity

title: Composting Systems Design
learning_objectives: Design appropriate composting systems, Understand carbon-nitrogen ratios, Manage moisture and aeration, Troubleshoot common problems
key_concepts: Hot composting vs cold composting, Carbon to nitrogen ratios, Moisture and oxygen requirements, Compost placement in zones, Sheet mulching, Vermicomposting

title: Mulching Strategies
learning_objectives: Select appropriate mulch materials, Apply mulch effectively, Understand mulch benefits, Avoid common mulching mistakes
key_concepts: Organic mulch types, Living mulches, Mulch depth guidelines, Termite and rodent considerations, Sheet mulching technique, Seasonal mulching

title: Cover Crops and Green Manures
learning_objectives: Select appropriate cover crops, Time planting and termination, Understand biomass building, Integrate into rotation
key_concepts: Cover crop selection by season, Nitrogen-fixing covers, Deep-rooted soil builders, Chop-and-drop timing, Seed vs transplant following, Multi-species cover mixes

title: Balcony and Rooftop Growing
learning_objectives: Design vertical growing systems, Manage weight restrictions, Select appropriate containers, Maximize limited space
key_concepts: Weight load calculations, Container selection, Vertical trellising, Intensive planting techniques, Microclimate creation, Water management in containers

title: Small Space Polyculture
learning_objectives: Design guilds for containers, Stack functions in small spaces, Create intensive polycultures, Manage succession planting
key_concepts: Container guilds, Vertical layering, Succession planting schedules, Companion planting in pots, Perennial vegetables for containers, Year-round production

title: Urban Microclimates
learning_objectives: Identify urban heat islands, Use building microclimates, Extend growing seasons, Protect from extreme weather
key_concepts: Heat retention by buildings, Wind tunnels and protection, Reflected light utilization, Frost pockets in cities, Season extension techniques, Microclimate mapping

title: Community Gardens and Social Permaculture
learning_objectives: Organize community spaces, Apply People Care ethics, Design shared systems, Manage group dynamics
key_concepts: Shared governance models, Individual vs communal plots, Tool sharing systems, Conflict resolution, Community building, Education programs, Food security

title: Food Forest Basics
learning_objectives: Understand food forest concept, Recognize succession stages, Plan long-term forest development, Design for multiple harvests
key_concepts: Food forest definition, Mimicking natural forests, Perennial emphasis, Succession planning, Timeframe expectations, Management vs wilderness

title: Canopy and Sub-Canopy Selection
learning_objectives: Select appropriate tree species, Plan spacing and timing, Understand mature sizes, Design for multiple yields
key_concepts: Native nut and fruit trees, Standard vs dwarf sizing, Spacing calculations, Grafting and varieties, Pollination requirements, Coppicing species

title: Understory Design
learning_objectives: Select shade-tolerant species, Design productive understories, Manage light succession, Plan temporal niches
key_concepts: Shade tolerance levels, Currants and berries, Perennial vegetables, Medicinal herbs, Spring ephemerals, Ferns and groundcovers

title: Food Forest Establishment
learning_objectives: Prepare site appropriately, Plant in succession, Establish support systems, Plan phased development
key_concepts: Site preparation methods, Planting timing by layer, Nurse plants, Windbreaks and support species, Irrigation during establishment, Mulching strategies

title: Food Forest Maintenance
learning_objectives: Develop maintenance schedules, Practice appropriate pruning, Manage succession, Harvest sustainably
key_concepts: Decreasing management over time, Pruning for production, Pest and disease management, Coppicing cycles, Harvest timing, Self-seeding and succession

title: The Three Ethics
learning_objectives: Understand Earth Care ethic, Apply People Care principles, Practice Fair Share, Make ethical design decisions
key_concepts: Earth Care as foundation, People Care in design, Fair Share and limits, Surplus redistribution, Ethics in decision-making, Long-term vs short-term thinking

title: The Twelve Design Principles
learning_objectives: Learn all twelve principles, Apply principles to design, Recognize principles in nature, Use principles for decision-making
key_concepts: Observe and interact, Catch and store energy, Obtain a yield, Self-regulation, Renewable resources, Produce no waste, Design from patterns, Integrate not segregate, Small and slow, Diversity, Edges, Creative response to change

title: Pattern Recognition in Nature
learning_objectives: Identify natural patterns, Apply patterns to design, Understand pattern functions, Scale patterns appropriately
key_concepts: Branching patterns, Spirals and waves, Lobes and clefts, Scatter and cluster, Sphere and dome, Pattern observation methods

title: Fair Share Economics
learning_objectives: Apply Fair Share to economics, Design sustainable livelihoods, Share surplus appropriately, Understand gift economy
key_concepts: Fair Share ethic in practice, Surplus redistribution, Gift economy, Local currencies, Appropriate profit, Economic resilience, Community wealth

title: People Care in Practice
learning_objectives: Design for human needs, Create inclusive systems, Support community health, Balance individual and collective
key_concepts: Human needs beyond food, Accessibility in design, Mental health considerations, Community building, Conflict resolution, Social sustainability
